pr_title: NMS-12426: Add docs for BMP support

timeline.message: NMS-12426: Add example config for BMP support
NMS-12426: Add docs for BMP integration
NMS-12426: Add docs for OpenBMP integration
NMS-12426: Add docs for bulkhead in BMP parser

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            _BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
          
          
            
            The _BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@

+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.
          
          
            
            The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows you to use these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management.

timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+
+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
+The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.

+[[telemetryd-bmp-parser]]

timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+
+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
+The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-parser]]
+===== BMP TCP Parser
+
+The BMP Parser accepts BMP connections from routers packets using a <<telemetryd-listener-tcp, TCP Listener>>.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.parser.BmpParser`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Parser
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter             | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `dnsLookupsEnabled`   | Used to enable or disable DNS resolution of router and peer hostnames.         | no       | true

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The BMP Telemetry Adapter is used to handle _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.
          
          
            
            The BMP Telemetry Adapter handles _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.
          
      
    
    
  

What is "statistic" data? Can we just say "data"?
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+
+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
+The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-parser]]
+===== BMP TCP Parser
+
+The BMP Parser accepts BMP connections from routers packets using a <<telemetryd-listener-tcp, TCP Listener>>.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.parser.BmpParser`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Parser
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter             | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `dnsLookupsEnabled`   | Used to enable or disable DNS resolution of router and peer hostnames.         | no       | true
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-statistics-adapter]]
+===== BMP Telemetry Adapter
+
+The BMP Telemetry Adapter is used to handle _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Received statistics are associated as performance data to the router sending the statistics (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
          
          
            
            Statistics received from the router are associated as performance data with that router. 
          
          
            
            The router must exist as a regular node in _{opennms-product-name}_.
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+
+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
+The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-parser]]
+===== BMP TCP Parser
+
+The BMP Parser accepts BMP connections from routers packets using a <<telemetryd-listener-tcp, TCP Listener>>.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.parser.BmpParser`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Parser
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter             | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `dnsLookupsEnabled`   | Used to enable or disable DNS resolution of router and peer hostnames.         | no       | true
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-statistics-adapter]]
+===== BMP Telemetry Adapter
+
+The BMP Telemetry Adapter is used to handle _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.
+Received statistics are associated as performance data to the router sending the statistics (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.
          
          
            
            {opennms-product-name} uses the IP address exporting BMP messages to associate a router with the particular _{opennms-product-name}_ node.
          
      
    
    
  

Not clear if this sentence is telling users to do this, or it's a statement of how OpenNMS does this by default.
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+
+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
+The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-parser]]
+===== BMP TCP Parser
+
+The BMP Parser accepts BMP connections from routers packets using a <<telemetryd-listener-tcp, TCP Listener>>.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.parser.BmpParser`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Parser
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter             | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `dnsLookupsEnabled`   | Used to enable or disable DNS resolution of router and peer hostnames.         | no       | true
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-statistics-adapter]]
+===== BMP Telemetry Adapter
+
+The BMP Telemetry Adapter is used to handle _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.
+Received statistics are associated as performance data to the router sending the statistics (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
+
+To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            In addition, the Nodes Meta Data can be used to specify a BGP ID which will then be used to associate routers.
          
          
            
            In addition, the node's metadata can specify a BGP ID, which will then be used to associate routers.
          
      
    
    
  

Not clear if this should be a possessive: "the node's metadata". Please verify.
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+
+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
+The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-parser]]
+===== BMP TCP Parser
+
+The BMP Parser accepts BMP connections from routers packets using a <<telemetryd-listener-tcp, TCP Listener>>.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.parser.BmpParser`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Parser
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter             | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `dnsLookupsEnabled`   | Used to enable or disable DNS resolution of router and peer hostnames.         | no       | true
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-statistics-adapter]]
+===== BMP Telemetry Adapter
+
+The BMP Telemetry Adapter is used to handle _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.
+Received statistics are associated as performance data to the router sending the statistics (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
+
+To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.
+In addition, the Nodes Meta Data can be used to specify a BGP ID which will then be used to associate routers.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a `context:key` meta data name which will be used to lookup a Node which has stored the queried BGP ID as value in exactly this key.
          
          
            
            If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a `context:key` metadata name, which will be used to lookup a node which has stored the queried BGP ID as a value in exactly this key.
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+
+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
+The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-parser]]
+===== BMP TCP Parser
+
+The BMP Parser accepts BMP connections from routers packets using a <<telemetryd-listener-tcp, TCP Listener>>.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.parser.BmpParser`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Parser
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter             | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `dnsLookupsEnabled`   | Used to enable or disable DNS resolution of router and peer hostnames.         | no       | true
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-statistics-adapter]]
+===== BMP Telemetry Adapter
+
+The BMP Telemetry Adapter is used to handle _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.
+Received statistics are associated as performance data to the router sending the statistics (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
+
+To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.
+In addition, the Nodes Meta Data can be used to specify a BGP ID which will then be used to associate routers.
+If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a `context:key` meta data name which will be used to lookup a Node which has stored the queried BGP ID as value in exactly this key.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The BMP Peer Status Adapter is used to create events for peer status changes.
          
          
            
            The BMP Peer Status Adapter creates events for peer status changes.
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+
+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
+The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-parser]]
+===== BMP TCP Parser
+
+The BMP Parser accepts BMP connections from routers packets using a <<telemetryd-listener-tcp, TCP Listener>>.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.parser.BmpParser`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Parser
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter             | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `dnsLookupsEnabled`   | Used to enable or disable DNS resolution of router and peer hostnames.         | no       | true
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-statistics-adapter]]
+===== BMP Telemetry Adapter
+
+The BMP Telemetry Adapter is used to handle _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.
+Received statistics are associated as performance data to the router sending the statistics (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
+
+To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.
+In addition, the Nodes Meta Data can be used to specify a BGP ID which will then be used to associate routers.
+If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a `context:key` meta data name which will be used to lookup a Node which has stored the queried BGP ID as value in exactly this key.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.adapter.BmpTelemetryAdapter`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Telemetry Adapter
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter            | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `metaDataNodeLookup` | Enables lookup using BGP IDs.                                                  | no       |
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-peer-status-adapter]]
+===== BMP Peer Status Adapter
+
+The BMP Peer Status Adapter is used to create events for peer status changes.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            It handles _BMP_ Peer Up and Down messages received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>> and converts them to _{opennms-product-name}_ Events.
          
          
            
            It handles _BMP_ Peer Up and Down messages that the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>> receives and parses, and converts to _{opennms-product-name}_ events.

+

timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+
+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
+The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-parser]]
+===== BMP TCP Parser
+
+The BMP Parser accepts BMP connections from routers packets using a <<telemetryd-listener-tcp, TCP Listener>>.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.parser.BmpParser`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Parser
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter             | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `dnsLookupsEnabled`   | Used to enable or disable DNS resolution of router and peer hostnames.         | no       | true
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-statistics-adapter]]
+===== BMP Telemetry Adapter
+
+The BMP Telemetry Adapter is used to handle _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.
+Received statistics are associated as performance data to the router sending the statistics (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
+
+To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.
+In addition, the Nodes Meta Data can be used to specify a BGP ID which will then be used to associate routers.
+If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a `context:key` meta data name which will be used to lookup a Node which has stored the queried BGP ID as value in exactly this key.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.adapter.BmpTelemetryAdapter`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Telemetry Adapter
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter            | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `metaDataNodeLookup` | Enables lookup using BGP IDs.                                                  | no       |
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-peer-status-adapter]]
+===== BMP Peer Status Adapter
+
+The BMP Peer Status Adapter is used to create events for peer status changes.
+It handles _BMP_ Peer Up and Down messages received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>> and converts them to _{opennms-product-name}_ Events.
+The created events are associated to the router sending the messages (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.
          
          
            
            {opennms-product-name} uses the IP address exporting BMP messages to associate a router with the particular _{opennms-product-name}_ node.
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+
+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
+The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-parser]]
+===== BMP TCP Parser
+
+The BMP Parser accepts BMP connections from routers packets using a <<telemetryd-listener-tcp, TCP Listener>>.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.parser.BmpParser`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Parser
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter             | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `dnsLookupsEnabled`   | Used to enable or disable DNS resolution of router and peer hostnames.         | no       | true
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-statistics-adapter]]
+===== BMP Telemetry Adapter
+
+The BMP Telemetry Adapter is used to handle _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.
+Received statistics are associated as performance data to the router sending the statistics (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
+
+To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.
+In addition, the Nodes Meta Data can be used to specify a BGP ID which will then be used to associate routers.
+If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a `context:key` meta data name which will be used to lookup a Node which has stored the queried BGP ID as value in exactly this key.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.adapter.BmpTelemetryAdapter`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Telemetry Adapter
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter            | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `metaDataNodeLookup` | Enables lookup using BGP IDs.                                                  | no       |
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-peer-status-adapter]]
+===== BMP Peer Status Adapter
+
+The BMP Peer Status Adapter is used to create events for peer status changes.
+It handles _BMP_ Peer Up and Down messages received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>> and converts them to _{opennms-product-name}_ Events.
+The created events are associated to the router sending the messages (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
+
+The events are called `uei.opennms.org/bmp/peerUp` and `uei.opennms.org/bmp/peerDown`.
+
+To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            In addition, the Nodes Meta Data can be used to specify a BGP ID which will then be used to associate routers.
          
          
            
            In addition, the node's metadata can specify a BGP ID, which will then be used to associate routers.

+
+The BMP Telemetry Adapter is used to handle _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.
+Received statistics are associated as performance data to the router sending the statistics (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
+
+To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.
+In addition, the Nodes Meta Data can be used to specify a BGP ID which will then be used to associate routers.
+If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a `context:key` meta data name which will be used to lookup a Node which has stored the queried BGP ID as value in exactly this key.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.adapter.BmpTelemetryAdapter`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Telemetry Adapter
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter            | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `metaDataNodeLookup` | Enables lookup using BGP IDs.                                                  | no       |
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-peer-status-adapter]]
+===== BMP Peer Status Adapter
+
+The BMP Peer Status Adapter is used to create events for peer status changes.
+It handles _BMP_ Peer Up and Down messages received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>> and converts them to _{opennms-product-name}_ Events.
+The created events are associated to the router sending the messages (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
+
+The events are called `uei.opennms.org/bmp/peerUp` and `uei.opennms.org/bmp/peerDown`.
+
+To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.
+In addition, the Nodes Meta Data can be used to specify a BGP ID which will then be used to associate routers.

            If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a `context:key` meta data name which will be used to lookup a Node which has stored the queried BGP ID as value in exactly this key.

timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+
+==== BGP Monitoring Protocol
+
+_BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP)_ provides a convenient interface for obtaining route views.
+The integration in _{opennms-product-name}_ allows to utilize these route views, status updates and statistics for monitoring and management purposes.
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-parser]]
+===== BMP TCP Parser
+
+The BMP Parser accepts BMP connections from routers packets using a <<telemetryd-listener-tcp, TCP Listener>>.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.parser.BmpParser`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Parser
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter             | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `dnsLookupsEnabled`   | Used to enable or disable DNS resolution of router and peer hostnames.         | no       | true
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-statistics-adapter]]
+===== BMP Telemetry Adapter
+
+The BMP Telemetry Adapter is used to handle _BMP_ statistic data received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>>.
+Received statistics are associated as performance data to the router sending the statistics (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
+
+To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.
+In addition, the Nodes Meta Data can be used to specify a BGP ID which will then be used to associate routers.
+If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a `context:key` meta data name which will be used to lookup a Node which has stored the queried BGP ID as value in exactly this key.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.adapter.BmpTelemetryAdapter`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the BMP Telemetry Adapter
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter            | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `metaDataNodeLookup` | Enables lookup using BGP IDs.                                                  | no       |
+|===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-bmp-peer-status-adapter]]
+===== BMP Peer Status Adapter
+
+The BMP Peer Status Adapter is used to create events for peer status changes.
+It handles _BMP_ Peer Up and Down messages received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>> and converts them to _{opennms-product-name}_ Events.
+The created events are associated to the router sending the messages (which must exists as regular Node in _{opennms-product-name}_).
+
+The events are called `uei.opennms.org/bmp/peerUp` and `uei.opennms.org/bmp/peerDown`.
+
+To associate a router with the according _{opennms-product-name}_ Node, the IP address exporting BMP messages is used.
+In addition, the Nodes Meta Data can be used to specify a BGP ID which will then be used to associate routers.
+If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a `context:key` meta data name which will be used to lookup a Node which has stored the queried BGP ID as value in exactly this key.

+[[telemetryd-openbmp-integration-adapter]]

+

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            It handles _BMP_ messages received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>> and creates _OpenBMP_ compatible messages which are then passed to the _OpenBMP_ kafka cluster.
          
          
            
            It handles _BMP_ messages the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>> receives and parses and creates _OpenBMP_-compatible messages, which are then passed to the _OpenBMP_ Kafka cluster.
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -82,3 +82,30 @@ If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a
 | Parameter            | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
 | `metaDataNodeLookup` | Enables lookup using BGP IDs.                                                  | no       |
 |===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-openbmp-integration-adapter]]
+===== OpenBMP Integration Adapter
+
+The OpenBMP Integration Adapter is used to integrate with an existing http://www.openbmp.org[OpenBMP] installation.
+It handles _BMP_ messages received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>> and creates _OpenBMP_ compatible messages which are then passed to the _OpenBMP_ kafka cluster.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            | `kafka.*`            | Options used to create OpenBMP kafka producer. All known kafka settings are allowed but prefixed with `kafka.`. | no       |
          
          
            
            | `kafka.*`            | Uses options to create OpenBMP Kafka producer. Allows all known Kafka settings, but prefixed with `kafka.`. | no       |
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -82,3 +82,30 @@ If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a
 | Parameter            | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
 | `metaDataNodeLookup` | Enables lookup using BGP IDs.                                                  | no       |
 |===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-openbmp-integration-adapter]]
+===== OpenBMP Integration Adapter
+
+The OpenBMP Integration Adapter is used to integrate with an existing http://www.openbmp.org[OpenBMP] installation.
+It handles _BMP_ messages received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>> and creates _OpenBMP_ compatible messages which are then passed to the _OpenBMP_ kafka cluster.
+
+This setup replaces the _Collector_ component of _OpenBMP_.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.adapter.openbmp.BmpIntegrationAdapter`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the OpenBMP Integration Adapter
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter            | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `kafka.*`            | Options used to create OpenBMP kafka producer. All known kafka settings are allowed but prefixed with `kafka.`. | no       |

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            | `topicPrefix`        | Prefix used before each kafka topic                                            | no       |
          
          
            
            | `topicPrefix`        | Prefix used before each Kafka topic.                                            | no       |
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -82,3 +82,30 @@ If the parameter `metaDataNodeLookup` is not empty, it will be interpreted as a
 | Parameter            | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
 | `metaDataNodeLookup` | Enables lookup using BGP IDs.                                                  | no       |
 |===
+
+
+[[telemetryd-openbmp-integration-adapter]]
+===== OpenBMP Integration Adapter
+
+The OpenBMP Integration Adapter is used to integrate with an existing http://www.openbmp.org[OpenBMP] installation.
+It handles _BMP_ messages received and parsed by the <<telemetryd-bmp-parser, BMP Parser>> and creates _OpenBMP_ compatible messages which are then passed to the _OpenBMP_ kafka cluster.
+
+This setup replaces the _Collector_ component of _OpenBMP_.
+
+====== Facts
+
+[options="autowidth"]
+|===
+| Class Name          | `org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.bmp.adapter.openbmp.BmpIntegrationAdapter`
+|===
+
+====== Parameters
+
+.Parameters for the OpenBMP Integration Adapter
+[options="header, autowidth"]
+|===
+| Parameter            | Description                                                                    | Required | Default value
+| `kafka.*`            | Options used to create OpenBMP kafka producer. All known kafka settings are allowed but prefixed with `kafka.`. | no       |
+| `topicPrefix`        | Prefix used before each kafka topic                                            | no       |
